title: Cardano Blue NFT Marketplace
description: Mary hard-fork以降、カルダノのNFTにまつわる様々な出来事が起きていますが、すべてがゆっくりと進んでいるように見えます。

f6_assessments.q0: NTF's has proven a major driver for Ethereum, but it has been plagued by the high gas fees. Having alternative platforms build on Cardano would be highly beneficial for NTF users/traders and would greatly advance the use of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
The only demonstration of experience is the testnet which looks nice and the technical info provided. The proposer offers a brief description of the 3 developers involved, but a bit more details on their past experience would give more re-assurance to voters. The same applies for the mentioned "software development company", what's the name of the company ? is it registered ? what else has it developed ? 
The budget could be a bit more detailed e.g. how are you going to use the $7000 for marketing and more specifics on the $12000 requested for "Legal and technical consultancy". I assume that the budget is covering the first 3 months of development but it is not very clear.
f6_assessments.q2: A timeline and milestones are presented. The proposal would benefit from making it more clear what it wants to achieve with the funds requested. There are no KPI's or metric of success defined, which will make it harder for the community to assess the proposal. How many users do you intend to capture in the first 6 months or how many NTF's to you expect to be traded in your platform would be useful KPI's

f6_assessments.q0:
Competition is good so another NFT marketplace can only do good. There is a community ready and waiting for a proper NFT marketplace.
Including governance in your project is extremely good for scaling and future challenges
f6_assessments.q1:
Already committed team and website.
Including details about your software company in your proposal might help to gain more trust from CAs and voters. The budget and plan behind it seems appropriate.
f6_assessments.q2: Proposal provides a clear roadmap and performance indicators. The governance sounds interesting. Will there be incentives for active community members in your governance system. You could provide more info on how customizable your NFT creation will be in regards to smart contracts. Can you create NFTs that pay royalties etc.? Will token holders be able to view a dashboard for distributed revenue?

f6_assessments.q0: Whether or not the centralised platform can attract NFT creators, the idea meets the purpose of the challenge. It is an example of how NFT's can be created and sold. It is not a unique resource for the community but a viable one.
f6_assessments.q1:
The experimental product exists, so that part is clear that - to some degree - the proposal can be implemented. But the likelihood of achieving the stated goals is much less certain. 
_"After 3 months:_
_The core of the application logic is ported to smart contracts_
_The platform supports creation of NFTs containing files other than images - documents, audio, video, etc._
_*Cardano Blue is number one choice for minting and trading of NFTs on Cardano*_
_*After 6 months:*_
_Introduction of governance to the platform_
_Stable growth of users_
_Expansion of the development and business team_
_*After 12 months:*_
_*Becoming one of the most important NFT platforms_
_Further development and improvement of the platform according to the community's needs, based on previously developed mechanisms which enable community governance_
_Developed native mobile applications for Android and iOS"_
f6_assessments.q2: Similar to the note for questions about implementing successfully, the objectives seem to be quite grand. Some goals will be measurable Others less so.

f6_assessments.q0: The project is in line with the current challenge as it's an implementation of an application to auction NFTs. Furthermore I believe it's going to have a great impact on the popularity of cardano since NFTs are a hot topick for some time now and are just finding economic ground.
f6_assessments.q1:
I believe the plan presented could be more detailed, but besides that it is a great start for such a project, keeping in mind that smart contracts are coming so soon. 
I like that the proposer has a plan for additional funding once everything is up and running and wouldn't only rely on funding rounds. This is a strong example for all further projects to follow and to rely on the community and the ecosystem rather than on "kickstarters".
I would really love to hear more about the company and the developers working in it, and take a look around because currently not much fact checking can be done on the company or developers. The proposer didn't mention if the project would be open source or not, but I'm keeping my fingers crossed for it to be open source.
There's a good description of what success would look like and I believe the time breakdown is competently done, given the work that needs to happen. I also like the proposer keeps in mind that the environment might change, and is open to listen to the community for guidance on how the project could evolve.
Simple and understandable language was used and the idea along with the plan for action are pretty straightforward and understandable.
f6_assessments.q2: There could be better breakdown on how the marketing and legal and technical consultancy funds will be used, but the given prices seemed legit after some digging in google on how much these things cost and being a developer myself. There could have been more info on how the project could be tracked by the community, but that is not to say the proposer hasn't given proper milestones like: application logic being transferred to work on top of smart contracts alongside introducing of governance in the future mobile application.

f6_assessments.q0: A NFT marketplace utilizing smart contracts is absolutely crucial as millions of native assets have already been minted within the last 5 months on Cardano. This proposal effectively addresses the dApp challenge
f6_assessments.q1: The team already has a centralized, but working product on the testnet, this gives me confidence that the team will likely be successful as they already have proven they are competent. They are also utilizing NextJS and GraphQL with TS which shows the team is experienced and know what they are doing, and will deliver a solid type-safe product to server the massive Cardano NFT market.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has provided clear goals in plain terms and have laid out a roadmap that appears to be more than achievable, especially given how far the team has already gotten. Voter's should keep this in mind when voting.

f6_assessments.q0:
I fully agree on the idea behind it but have the feeling the proposal team missed to inform and define a clear problem they want to solve. Also I miss the clear explanation what are distinguishing factors of their product from the competition (which is big and growing by day) - this kind of info should be highlighted.
However I like the fact they want to give 50% of the platform's revenue to their token holders - this might set them apart from others?
The functional testnet site is created and needs further work and refinements, but the core is there. What this team needs now is a successful transfer of existing business logic to smart contracts and decentralize the core of the application and some cash-flow.

Some of the basic information about this project I found in comments section which should not be the case, but having in mind the good idea and potential benefits to community I agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge (for this early stage).

(The least of an issue is that this project should maybe be in another category "NFT Business models")
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is not identified (for example with LinkedIn profiles) and the "software development company" as they refer themselves remains unknown. There is no reference on whether the team is capable of developing and implementing such a complex solution. 
Detailed step-by-step roadmap is not provided and the statements (for example: "After 3 months:
Cardano Blue is number one choice for minting and trading of NFTs on Cardano") are over-inflated with giving no information on how are they going to achieve this. 
Also budgeting info could be more detailed.

With all the information given, many important questions remain unanswered, so I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal has a high probability of successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
The timeline is very vaguely defined, with no specific dates or milestones on which the project depends. The KPI is only one (The main goal for the coming months is to convert present logic to smart contracts) - I believe more detailed KPI's should be addressed to assure every step of this project is achieved.
Although this nice idea is not new and will happen to someone in near future, the team (unknown to us - bad transparency) is not assuring that potential risks that can arise with developing such a solution can be overcame with success.
Based on the given info, I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal provides us with sufficient information to review its progress.

solution: 私たちは、集中型のNFTマーケットプレイスとオークションハウスを作りましたが、これをさらに発展させ、スマートコントラクトに移行させたいと考えています。
experience: 当社はソフトウェア開発会社であり、複雑なソリューションの開発に長年の経験を持つ数十名のエンジニアを擁しています。
